title: UPDATED "50 STATES OF RECYCLING" ASSESSMENT FINDS THAT WELL-DESIGNED POLICY IS CRITICAL TO ... - PR Newswire
summary: Recycling rates in the U.S. have stagnated or declined, despite the environmental and economic benefits of recycling. A new report highlights the need for more accurate data, policy, and infrastructure investment to improve statewide recycling rates. Recycling Refunds (bottle bills or Deposit Return Systems) are effective in increasing recycling rates and maximizing closed-loop recycling.

title: Updated U.S. recycling report finds $6.5 billion worth of material lost to landfill annually - Recycling Product News
summary: A new report from Eunomia Research & Consulting and Ball Corporation finds that states with recycling refunds have significantly higher recycling rates than states without them. The report also finds that the U.S. recycles just 45.2 percent of aluminum cans, and that increasing the recycling rate of aluminum cans to 90 percent by 2030 would create opportunities to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and grow the U.S. economy.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the report describes the environmental benefits of increasing the recycling rate of aluminum cans, which is a green innovation.

title: Serial clothes shoppers to be targeted in new sustainability campaign - TheJournal.ie
summary: The Irish government plans to launch a public awareness campaign in 2024 to encourage consumers to buy fewer clothes and adopt more sustainable behaviors. The campaign will target "high frequency purchasers," who buy clothes several times a week and often purchase items they never wear. The government's goal is to move Ireland towards a circular economy in which products are kept in circulation as long as possible through reuse, repair, and recycling.
greenwashing: The article does not provide any information about greenwashing.
